author: Afraid Of Valerie
text:
I've come across yet another example of this sort of thing just now. I couldn't agree more with @MarkPl08 .

Not to get on my high horse, but this is ridiculous, Resident Evil Twitter. If someone simply disagrees, it's OKAY.

LET IT GO, and move on.

Sorry, lMark.

#REBHFun https://t.co/Zsi61yZ06U https://t.co/crd455RADE

author: Afraid Of Valerie
text: Oh, COME ON! Don't make me choose between them! 🤣 https://t.co/Z2krZzSvsP

author: Afraid Of Valerie
text: Seriously, though. Heinz 57 Sauce kicks ass.

author: Afraid Of Valerie
text:
Not with a comment, but with a smile. I may even laugh or giggle.

But if it was the right type of person, I'd secretly think, "You know nothing, you impertinent bastard." https://t.co/8JvtbYS0Ii

author: Afraid Of Valerie
text: A Nightmare on Elm Street: The Series (Freddy's Nightmares) https://t.co/KP4a3mqDFE

author: Afraid Of Valerie
text: I somewhat liked the movie Paul, so I'd say that counts. https://t.co/046w7QcAkV

author: Afraid Of Valerie
text: Sega's S.C.U.D. Race (Super GT in the States), House of the Dead, Virtua Fighter, Ms. Pac Man, and Mortal Kombat II https://t.co/rCCR2I881d

author: Afraid Of Valerie
text: Wendy McClendon Covey as Beverly Goldberg https://t.co/uJS37f9tgC

author: Afraid Of Valerie
text:
The world has bigger, more pressing, problems than this. 

Tell me: Am I just full of crap here?

Are we not allowed to say anything that resembles the slightest bit of objective criticism anymore, even if it's valid or beneficial?

I mean, what is this? Orwell's 1984?

author: Afraid Of Valerie
text:
I just wish some people wouldn't place so much importance on stuff like this.

Seriously. Is it really worth getting all worked up (or losing any friends, even) over mere differences in opinion or perspective about a video game character (or any aspect of said game), in general?

author: Afraid Of Valerie
text:
I respect your opinion (like I'd hope you'll respect mine) and your right to have it.

If I say something that happens to rub you the wrong way, let's tactfully talk it out like adults. I'm willing to listen.

Again, it's not my intent to antagonize anyone out here on Twitter.

author: Afraid Of Valerie
text:
I really am sorry if you happen to be upset by a comment I happen to make, but if my opinions tend to bother you this much, go ahead and unfollow me now.

I'm not here to amass a huge following or become an influencer. I just want to be myself here and maybe grow as a person.

author: Afraid Of Valerie
text:
Again, not to be rude or critical, but... it's usually fans of Japanese RPGs who tend to do this. It's one of the reasons I tend to avoid them in general.

Look, it's not my intent to go around and offend anyone and everyone I come across here, but I apologize if it does happen.

author: Afraid Of Valerie
text:
I hope nobody takes this personally, but I wonder... Do people actually think I'm going out of my way to be an asshole and "slander" a game series if I just state my opinion about a character?

Must we throw the word "slander" around when someone makes remarks we disagree with?

author: Afraid Of Valerie
text:
Likely the latter. I know I'd do it. 

Plus it's funnier that way. https://t.co/228wOpMQnH

author: Afraid Of Valerie
text:
It's Rean. What else is there to say? Of course I like Rean.

If you don't like him, you don't have a soul. That's my opinion. https://t.co/jqmFyfNA79

author: Afraid Of Valerie
text:
Estelle and Joshua's father, from my understanding. Isn't he one of those "S-Ranked" Bracers?

Yeah, uh... Don't wanna piss him off, then. https://t.co/8yOio1Byyx

author: Afraid Of Valerie
text: I've never come across him, but I wonder what he's like... I heard about him from Rean and others for years. https://t.co/yq7kKk0vHB

author: Afraid Of Valerie
text: "First photo of a cannibal dog." https://t.co/suHrEVUewb

author: Afraid Of Valerie
text: "Never go in my back yard." https://t.co/fa2HHocUFc

author: Afraid Of Valerie
text:
I'm about to make a cartoony picture of myself walking OUT of Twitter if I see so much as one more of those "[insert Sonic character's name] goes into [insert store name]" tweets today.

#joke

author: Afraid Of Valerie
text: Seriously, though... What's with all the tweets about cake and tea today? I'm seeing a lot of them in my timeline. 🙂

author: Afraid Of Valerie
text:
Now if only the music video for that Tom Petty song carried on with Hilda taking Tom Petty's place and Lysithea instead of Alice, we'll be in business.

And that video's whole "dinner party" scene... Yeah, take THAT, Lysithea. https://t.co/q4kg8o4z6s

author: Afraid Of Valerie
text:
I mean, are these companies even aware that this stuff is going on? And if so, then do they even CARE that it's going on? They aren't the ones profitting from it.

Why the hell can't those with the rights be bothered to grant the licenses for more runs if the demand's there?

author: Afraid Of Valerie
text:
Do these companies even realize this crap's going on? And if so, do they even care?

Again, I'm not trying to be controversial, but this trend frustrates me to no end. Seriously. It drives me up the damn wall.

author: Afraid Of Valerie
text:
And by the time I finally find out the damn thing even exists, it's too late.

By then, YouTubers with their vulgar displys of wealth have already made videos, showing it off, and the only way for me to get it is to pay some scumbag scalper five times the original price.

author: Afraid Of Valerie
text: But what really drives me crazy is when there's a license to produce, say, 3,000 copies of any product and then said product sells out almost immediately.

author: Afraid Of Valerie
text:
Now don't get me wrong. I think it's a wonderful thing to get a physical release for a game or other product that otherwise wouldn't have one.

I strongly prefer physical media over digital media any day! Especially when it comes to my video games!

author: Afraid Of Valerie
text: I'm not attempting to be controversial, but I confess that I'm... fed up with companies like Limited Run Games these days. I also admit that I likely don't fully understand the whole process that goes into manufacturing these products or licensing them for release.

author: Afraid Of Valerie
text: I am, too. https://t.co/RE9vtoT3Ct

author: Afraid Of Valerie
text: Would the Ogre Battle series count? https://t.co/tT0veZkpbu

author: Afraid Of Valerie
text:
I don't, personally.

I would be grateful for an award, of course, but I mainly just care about whether I'm enjoying what I do and if I find it fulfilling. https://t.co/Nr1FcLZ2WB

author: Afraid Of Valerie
text:
Both.

Makoto kicks ass. https://t.co/Aq37NhOfZR
